definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to impersonate/to pose as (someone else)/to counterfeit/to palm off (a fake as a genuine)
to feign/to pretend to be/to pass oneself off as
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own

sentences.english: I am sailing against waves and squalls on the rough icy sea.
sentences.chinese: 迎着风浪，冒着沉没的危险，我在冰海中艰难地航行。
泉水咕嘟咕嘟地往外冒。

sentences.english: The smouldering wreck fumed thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 燃烧的残骸冒出浓烈的黑烟。

sentences.english: Then go back to your problem and write down any ideas that come to mind.
sentences.chinese: 之后再回到你的问题，并写下脑海里冒出的想法。

sentences.english: Water bubbled up through the sand.

sentences.chinese: hazard攀岩者有时冒着生命危险。

sentences.english: They are going so far as the new problems come up.
sentences.chinese: 他们讨论的深入新的问题也冒了出来。

sentences.english: He walked back home through the fine drizzle that was now falling.
sentences.chinese: 他冒著正在下著的微微细雨走回家。

sentences.english: The pipe lighted; smoke belched forth.
sentences.chinese: 烟斗点着了，烟雾冒了出来。

sentences.english: He jeopardized his life to save the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他冒着生命危险挽救那个快要淹死的孩子。

sentences.english: Is cold sky of light prologues, that mild eye Jing but all over undressed.
sentences.chinese: 冷天淡淡开口，那双平淡的眼精时而冒出精光。

sentences.english: He ducked right down to the bottom and when he came up again, he was quite beside himself.
sentences.chinese: 可是当他再冒到水面上来的时候，却感想很是寥寂。

sentences.english: Too big a risk, even with Mr. Eastwood at the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 纵使有伊斯特伍德保驾护航，冒的险也忒大了吧。

sentences.english: In Merca you risk your life if caught watching the football game.
sentences.chinese: 在梅尔卡，如果被抓到看球可是要冒生命危险的。

sentences.english: Dense smoke coming out of No. 4 engine cowling (engine nacelle), fire suspected.
sentences.chinese: 第四号发动机整流罩冒浓烟，可能着火。

sentences.english: And I want to thank all of you for braving the cold and the crowds and traveling in some cases thousands of miles to join us here today.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢冒着严寒千里迢迢赶来的人们。

definition: to emerge/to crop up/a little more than
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to crop up/to pop up/to emerge abruptly
to get out of a predicament/to stick out/to take the initiative/remaining odd fraction after a division/a little more than
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
